articles.headline: Complaints as Amazon Raises Cost of Prime
articles.snippet: The annual fee for Amazon Prime, the two-day shipping service, will jump 25 percent, to $99.
articles.abstract: The annual fee for Amazon Prime, the two-day shipping service, will jump 25 percent, to $99.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — People like getting their toys fast. They also like getting them cheap.

articles.headline: U.S. Agrees to Allow BP Back Into Gulf Waters to Seek Oil
articles.snippet: Under the agreement, BP will be allowed to bid for new leases as early as next Wednesday, but only as long as the company passes muster on ethics, corporate governance and safety procedures.
articles.abstract: Under the agreement, BP will be allowed to bid for new leases as early as next Wednesday, but only as long as the company passes muster on ethics, corporate governance and safety procedures.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Four years after the Deepwater Horizon rig explosion, BP is being welcomed back to seek new oil leases in the Gulf of Mexico.

articles.headline: 303 Deaths Seen in G.M. Cars With Failed Air Bags
articles.snippet: A safety watchdog says an accident trend went unnoticed by regulators before the recall of two models last month.
articles.abstract: A safety watchdog says an accident trend went unnoticed by regulators before the recall of two models last month.
articles.lead_paragraph: As lawmakers press General Motors and regulators over their decade-long failure to correct a defective ignition switch, a new review of federal crash data shows that 303 people died after the air bags failed to deploy on two of the models that were recalled last month.
articles.byline: By Danielle Ivory and Hilary Stout

articles.headline: A Kiss Is Just a Kiss, Unless It’s an Ad for a Clothing Company
articles.snippet: Some experts suggest that a video sensation showing 10 pairs of strangers kissing for the first time could force major fashion designers to rethink how they advertise.
articles.abstract: Some experts suggest that a video sensation showing 10 pairs of strangers kissing for the first time could force major fashion designers to rethink how they advertise.
articles.lead_paragraph: The email Tatia Pilieva sent to 21 people Monday morning started off the way such notes usually do when someone wants to get a link on Facebook.

articles.headline: A Review of Banks in Europe Gets Results
articles.snippet: UniCredit’s announcement of a 15 billion euro loss is seen as an attempt to get out in front of a European Central Bank review of large banks.
articles.abstract: UniCredit’s announcement of a 15 billion euro loss is seen as an attempt to get out in front of a European Central Bank review of large banks.
articles.lead_paragraph: What is an asset worth? How much capital does a bank really have?

articles.headline: U.S.-Russia Talks on Ukraine Fail to Ease Tension
articles.snippet: As Moscow ordered more military exercises on Ukraine’s border, Secretary of State John Kerry met the Russian foreign minister but failed to find a solution.
articles.abstract: As Moscow ordered more military exercises on Ukraine’s border, Secretary of State John Kerry met the Russian foreign minister but failed to find a solution.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — An 11th-hour bid by Secretary of State John Kerry to ease the escalating crisis over the Kremlin’s intervention in Crimea ended in failure on Friday, raising the likelihood of sanctions against Russia and deepening the most serious East-West rift since the end of the Cold War.
articles.byline: By Michael R. Gordon and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: Consumers Not Powerless in the Face of Credit Card Fraud
articles.snippet: Some tips to keep yourself from becoming a victim of credit and debit card fraud, at least until merchants and banks give you a hand.
articles.abstract: Some tips to keep yourself from becoming a victim of credit and debit card fraud, at least until merchants and banks give you a hand.
articles.lead_paragraph: When you think about the security of your credit and debit cards, consider the facts on the ground.
